alert.note: Alert for Monroe Middle Keys; Monroe Upper Keys (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Key West (Key West - The Florida Keys)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 3:54PM EST until December 17 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Key West
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT... * WHAT...Water levels are running about 1.5 feet above the predicted tides across the Middle Keys, and the next higher high tide later this evening will reach a little more than 1.5 feet above mean higher high water. In relation to last night`s tide, tonight`s tide will be about a half foot lower. For the Upper Keys, current water levels will be maintained as west winds prevent any relief for the Bayside communities of Key Largo. * WHERE...Middle and Upper Florida Keys. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Saltwater flooding of low elevation streets and lots is expected. Some storm drains will overflow, and some seawalls and docks will be overtopped. Boaters can expect less clearance under fixed bridges. Motorists should remember that persistent puddles around the times of high tide are almost certain to contain a mix of saltwater.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.

area.areaDesc: Monroe Middle Keys; Monroe Upper Keys
